comments:
This course is a junior lab with design projects based on heat transfer and mechanics of materials. In the broader context of design/independent skill development, this course also introduces open ended topics, wider design options, and introduces project planning and management.

Overall, students agreed that this course was a “pleasure” when compared to the pre-requisite design lab, MEAM 347. Many appreciated the “creativity of the labs” and thought that the “labs did a good job of incorporating course concepts.” However, students also agreed that many of the labs were not “very well designed” with an apparent “lack of focus on applicable, practical skills.”

Many students “appreciated Professor Yim’s sincere effort,” although most students were still not able to understand his teaching style. Many students were concerned about the late timing of instructions within the labs. Many students wished that there were “more instruction at the beginning (as opposed to halfway through)” of each lab.

This course is targeted toward MEAM major students in their junior year. Many students commented on the “apparent lack of grading metrics.” Others had a difficult time with the “unrealistic” time commitment imposed by the short time frames in which certain tasks and projects must be completed. Most students; however, thought that this lab course was a vast improvement over other junior MEAM labs.
